trans-unit.source: Welcome to the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground
trans-unit.target: Welcome to the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground

trans-unit.source: We are happy to announce the official grand opening of the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground (or WDGCPOPP, pronounced "wedge-kuh-pop").
trans-unit.target: We are happy to announce the official grand opening of the WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground (or WDGCPOPP, pronounced "wedge-kuh-pop").

trans-unit.source: Git logo](images/github-logo.png) **+**  ![Markdown logo
trans-unit.target: Git logo](images/github-logo.png) **+**  ![Markdown logo

trans-unit.source: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.
trans-unit.target: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you are already familiar with GitHub *and* are part of the Microsoft organization, skip to the ["Set up your own personal playground"](Welcome.md#set-up-your-own-personal-playground) section.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you are already familiar with GitHub *and* are part of the Microsoft organization, skip to the ["Set up your own personal playground"](Welcome.md#set-up-your-own-personal-playground) section.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization
trans-unit.target: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization

trans-unit.source: There are two steps getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub:
trans-unit.target: There are two steps getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub:

trans-unit.source: **Sign up for GitHub** -- Go to [https://github.com/](https://github.com/) and sign up as a new user.
trans-unit.target: **Sign up for GitHub** -- Go to [https://github.com/](https://github.com/) and sign up as a new user.

trans-unit.source: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.
trans-unit.target: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.

trans-unit.source: **Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization** -- For this step, follow the instructions at [How to Join the Microsoft Organization](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service).
trans-unit.target: **Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization** -- For this step, follow the instructions at [How to Join the Microsoft Organization](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service).

trans-unit.source: [Open Source Hub](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.
trans-unit.target: [Open Source Hub](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.

trans-unit.source: Set up your own personal playground
trans-unit.target: Set up your own personal playground

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with Git and markdown, read the [Learn More](Welcome.md#learn-more) section below.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with Git and markdown, read the [Learn More](Welcome.md#learn-more) section below.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready to jump in:
trans-unit.target: When you are ready to jump in:

trans-unit.source: Create a folder `<your-alias>` as a child of `wdg-cpub-test`.
trans-unit.target: Create a folder `<your-alias>` as a child of `wdg-cpub-test`.

trans-unit.source: Start writing!
trans-unit.target: Start writing!

trans-unit.source: To incorporate content into the table of contents, add the topics to the `TOC.md` file, using markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: To incorporate content into the table of contents, add the topics to the `TOC.md` file, using markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Any broken link in the repo, including image references, will break the build.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Any broken link in the repo, including image references, will break the build.

trans-unit.source: Before pushing to the remote, please check your links and follow the [local build instructions](https://ppe.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/partnerdocs/local-build-and-preview) to ensure you're not blocking updates to the rendered site.
trans-unit.target: Before pushing to the remote, please check your links and follow the [local build instructions](https://ppe.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/partnerdocs/local-build-and-preview) to ensure you're not blocking updates to the rendered site.

trans-unit.source: If you're not sure what "pushing to the remote" means, see ["learn more about Git"](Welcome.md#about-git).
trans-unit.target: If you're not sure what "pushing to the remote" means, see ["learn more about Git"](Welcome.md#about-git).

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: This section provides resources for learning more about [Open Publishing](Welcome.md#about-open-publishing), [Git](Welcome.md#about-git), and [markdown](Welcome.md#about-markdown).
trans-unit.target: This section provides resources for learning more about [Open Publishing](Welcome.md#about-open-publishing), [Git](Welcome.md#about-git), and [markdown](Welcome.md#about-markdown).

trans-unit.source: ...about Open Publishing
trans-unit.target: ...about Open Publishing

trans-unit.source: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP) has its own set of [documentation](https://ppe.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction) which contains information on performing local builds, HTML whitelists, and other Open Publishing-specific information.
trans-unit.target: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP) has its own set of [documentation](https://ppe.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction) which contains information on performing local builds, HTML whitelists, and other Open Publishing-specific information.

trans-unit.source: ...about Git
trans-unit.target: ...about Git

trans-unit.source: There are many resources on using Git available online.
trans-unit.target: There are many resources on using Git available online.

trans-unit.source: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub (see the [GitHub home page](https://github.com)).
trans-unit.target: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub (see the [GitHub home page](https://github.com)).

trans-unit.source: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:
trans-unit.target: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:

trans-unit.source: [Pro Git online book](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2) -- Exhaustive and authoritative reference on all things Git
trans-unit.target: [Pro Git online book](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2) -- Exhaustive and authoritative reference on all things Git

trans-unit.source: [Online Git tutorial](http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/) -- An introduction to Git basics
trans-unit.target: [Online Git tutorial](http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/) -- An introduction to Git basics

trans-unit.source: [Interactive tutorial on Git branching](http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/) -- Work through a series of lessons on Git fundamentals
trans-unit.target: [Interactive tutorial on Git branching](http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/) -- Work through a series of lessons on Git fundamentals

trans-unit.source: ...about markdown
trans-unit.target: ...about markdown

trans-unit.source: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is [Daring Fireball](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
trans-unit.target: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is [Daring Fireball](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

trans-unit.source: Choosing the right tools
trans-unit.target: Choosing the right tools

trans-unit.source: WDG CPub doesn't provide specific tools recommendations.
trans-unit.target: WDG CPub doesn't provide specific tools recommendations.

trans-unit.source: What follows are some options that have been used during various pilot projects.
trans-unit.target: What follows are some options that have been used during various pilot projects.

trans-unit.source: As you experiment with different tools, please update these lists with your findings.
trans-unit.target: As you experiment with different tools, please update these lists with your findings.

trans-unit.source: ...for markdown authoring
trans-unit.target: ...for markdown authoring

trans-unit.source: **[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).
trans-unit.target: **[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).

trans-unit.source: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.
trans-unit.target: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.

trans-unit.source: **[MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/)** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.
trans-unit.target: **[MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/)** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.

trans-unit.source: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).
trans-unit.target: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).

trans-unit.source: **[Atom](http://atom.io)** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.
trans-unit.target: **[Atom](http://atom.io)** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.

trans-unit.source: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.
trans-unit.target: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.

trans-unit.source: **Notepad** -- For the lover of simplicity.
trans-unit.target: **Notepad** -- For the lover of simplicity.

trans-unit.source: **Visual Studio** -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.
trans-unit.target: **Visual Studio** -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.

trans-unit.source: The Web Essentials plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.
trans-unit.target: The Web Essentials plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.

trans-unit.source: ...for Git management
trans-unit.target: ...for Git management

trans-unit.source: **[GitHub UI](https://github.com)** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.
trans-unit.target: **[GitHub UI](https://github.com)** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.

trans-unit.source: **[GitHub Desktop](https://git-for-windows.github.io/)** -- Allows you to manage different repos offline and handle merge conflicts.
trans-unit.target: **[GitHub Desktop](https://git-for-windows.github.io/)** -- Allows you to manage different repos offline and handle merge conflicts.

trans-unit.source: **[Tortoise Git](https://tortoisegit.org/)** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.
trans-unit.target: **[Tortoise Git](https://tortoisegit.org/)** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.

trans-unit.source: **[SourceTree](https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/overview)** -- A more feature-rich GUI than GitHub Desktop.
trans-unit.target: **[SourceTree](https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/overview)** -- A more feature-rich GUI than GitHub Desktop.

trans-unit.source: (**Note:** Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions [here](https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Two-Factor+Authentication+%282FA%29+with+GitHub+in+SourceTree).)
trans-unit.target: (**Note:** Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions [here](https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Two-Factor+Authentication+%282FA%29+with+GitHub+in+SourceTree).)

trans-unit.source: **[PoshGit](https://github.com/dahlbyk/posh-git)** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: **[PoshGit](https://github.com/dahlbyk/posh-git)** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: **[Git-Scm](http://www.git-scm.com/downloads)** -- Git on the command line.
trans-unit.target: **[Git-Scm](http://www.git-scm.com/downloads)** -- Git on the command line.

trans-unit.source: (For real retro charm, write [markdown in Emacs](http://jblevins.org/projects/markdown-mode/).)
trans-unit.target: (For real retro charm, write [markdown in Emacs](http://jblevins.org/projects/markdown-mode/).)

trans-unit.source: **Visual Studio and [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.
trans-unit.target: **Visual Studio and [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.

trans-unit.source: Tips and Tricks
trans-unit.target: Tips and Tricks

trans-unit.source: Brand new to Git?
trans-unit.target: Brand new to Git?

trans-unit.source: Command-line phobic?
trans-unit.target: Command-line phobic?

trans-unit.source: Check out [Recommended tools for beginners](jasgro/tools-for-beginners.md) for recommendations on how to get started.
trans-unit.target: Check out [Recommended tools for beginners](jasgro/tools-for-beginners.md) for recommendations on how to get started.

trans-unit.source: Instructions for [editing content through the GitHub UI](domars/Directions_To_Update_Existing_Topic_Using_Browser.md), a way to make updates without a local clone.
trans-unit.target: Instructions for [editing content through the GitHub UI](domars/Directions_To_Update_Existing_Topic_Using_Browser.md), a way to make updates without a local clone.

trans-unit.source: Tables have you down?
trans-unit.target: Tables have you down?

trans-unit.source: Check out some [markdown table creation tips](jasgro/table_creation_tools.md).
trans-unit.target: Check out some [markdown table creation tips](jasgro/table_creation_tools.md).

trans-unit.target: This is only for TEST1111111
